title: News View :: The World On Arirang
text: For the first time, a yellow flag warning protesters was spotted on the roof of the People's Liberation Army barracks on Sunday night.The flag read "all consequences are at your own risk" in English and Cantonese.But the warning didn't stop tens of thousands of people marching through Hong Kong Island and Kowloon Tong over the weekend, demanding greater democracy.Most covered their faces with medical masks, and even facepaint or Halloween masks, shouting that wearing a mask is not a crime."We are trying to give them a message that we are not afraid of the government no matter how they oppress us we will still fight to the end."The protests again turned violent, with police firing tear gas at protesters while some protesters threw bricks and petrol bombs.Demonstrators blocked roads and vandalized subway stations and businesses owned by companies that raised their voice against the pro-democracy protests.Over the weekend, a group of pro-democracy Hong Kong legislators filed a legal challenge against the government's use of a colonial-era emergency law that bans the wearing of face masks at protests.In fact, the South China Morning Post reported that Hong Kong may put military forces in Hong Kong if the city declares a state of emergency, especially as Beijing celebrated its national day back on October 1st.KIM Da-mi, Arirang News.
description: 한국을 대표하는 글로벌 방송! The World On Arirang!
